--- title: Psoas Minor Muscle --- ![Muscles of the Iliac and Anterior femoral regions @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Myology/image430 Muscles of the iliac and anterior femoral regions.gif) ![Muscles of the Abdomen @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.16 Muscles of the Abdomen.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.16} ::: {.callout title="Reading list"} - Psoas major, psoas minor, iliacus muscles @donnellyTravellSimonsSimons2019 - Neuman @neumannKinesiologyMusculoskeletalSystem2017 - MMT @weinstockNeuroKineticTherapyInnovative2010 ::: ::: {#tbl-oian .cell message='false' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Psoas Minor T12, L1 vertebrae (lateral aspect) and IVD Pectineal Line
Iliopubic ramus
Iliac fascia
Inguinal ligament		 Spinal nn.
L1 - L3		 Trunk: Weak flexion
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} T12, L1 vertebrae and intervertebral disk (lateral surfaces) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Insertion {#insertion} Pectineal line, iliopubic ramus, iliac fascia; lowermost fibers may reach inguinal lig. @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Innervation {#innervation} L1–L2 (L3) spinal nn. @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} Weak flexor of the trunk @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Overview Found in only 50% of the population @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 “The psoas minor, present in approximately 50% of the population, is often found on the superficial surface of the psoas major (see Fig. 31.19). It is not a muscle of the lower limb. It originates, inserts, and exerts its action on the abdomen” @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Stretches {#stretch} - [3D hip flexor stretch]({{< var ref-3d-hip-flexor-stretch.path >}})
